questions.text: **20 Women** are working for **five hours a day** completed a work in **15 days**. If **10 more women** joined and all women are working for **four hours a day**, then in how many days the work will be completed?
questions.solution:
Assume efficiency of each woman is 1 unit.
Total Work = $$20 \times 5 \times 15 = 1500$$ units.
New number of women = $$20 + 10 = 30$$.
New working hours = 4 hours/day.
Let the required time be T.
$$30 \times T \times 4 = 1500$$
$$120T = 1500$$
$$T = 12.5$$ days.
**Hence option A is correct.**

questions.text: **20 men** can complete a work in **10 days** and **10 women** can complete the same work in **24 days**. Then find **5 men and 8 women** can complete **3.5 times of work** in how many days?
questions.solution:
Efficiency relation:
$$20m \times 10 = 10w \times 24$$
$$200m = 240w$$
$$5m = 6w \Rightarrow m:w = 6:5$$.
Let $$m=6p, w=5p$$.
Total work = $$20 \times 6p \times 10 = 1200p$$.
Target work = $$1200p \times 3.5 = 4200p$$.
Combined efficiency of 5 men and 8 women:
$$(5 \times 6p) + (8 \times 5p) = 30p + 40p = 70p$$.
Required Time = $$4200p / 70p = 60$$ days.
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **(m+2) men** working **8 hours a day** can complete **40% of a work** in **4 days**. **(m+10) men** working **4 hours a day** can complete the **remaining work** in **6 days**. What is **2m**?
questions.solution:
Using $$\frac{M_1 D_1 H_1}{W_1} = \frac{M_2 D_2 H_2}{W_2}$$
$$\frac{(m+2) \times 4 \times 8}{40} = \frac{(m+10) \times 6 \times 4}{60}$$
$$\frac{(m+2) \times 32}{40} = \frac{(m+10) \times 24}{60}$$
$$\frac{(m+2) \times 4}{5} = \frac{(m+10) \times 2}{5}$$
$$2(m+2) = m+10$$
$$2m + 4 = m + 10 \Rightarrow m = 6$$.
Required value = $$2m = 2 \times 6 = 12$$.
**Hence option E is correct (since 12 is not in options).**

questions.text: **52 female labours** earned **Rs. 234000** by constructing a shed in **30 days**. How many **male labours** must work for **25 days** to receive **Rs. 262500** provided the daily wages of a male labour is **twice** that of a female labour?
questions.solution:
Earnings of 52 females in 1 day = $$234000 / 30 = Rs. 7800$$.
Earnings of 1 female in 1 day = $$7800 / 52 = Rs. 150$$.
Daily wage of 1 male = $$2 \times 150 = Rs. 300$$.
Earnings of 1 male in 25 days = $$300 \times 25 = Rs. 7500$$.
Number of males required = $$262500 / 7500 = 35$$ men.
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: **Anand** alone completes the work in **30 days** and **Bhiku** alone complete the work in **24 days** and **Anand, Bhiku and Charu** together can complete the work in **10 days**. If they earned the total wages **Rs. 1920**, what is the share of **Charu**?
questions.solution:
Let Total Work = LCM(30, 24, 10) = 120 units.
Efficiency of Anand = $$120/30 = 4$$.
Efficiency of Bhiku = $$120/24 = 5$$.
Efficiency of (Anand+Bhiku+Charu) = $$120/10 = 12$$.
Efficiency of Charu = $$12 - (4+5) = 3$$.
Wages are distributed in the ratio of efficiency: 4 : 5 : 3.
Total parts = $$4+5+3 = 12$$.
Charu's share = $$\frac{3}{12} \times 1920 = Rs. 480$$.
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **Akash** alone completes the work in **60 days** and **Bikash** alone completes the work in **30 days**. They get wages of **Rs. 12000** for the entire work. With the help of **Cypher**, they finish the work in **10 days**. How much money will Akash be paid?
questions.solution:
Let Total Work = 60 units.
Akash efficiency = $$60/60 = 1$$.
Bikash efficiency = $$60/30 = 2$$.
(Akash+Bikash+Cypher) efficiency = $$60/10 = 6$$.
Cypher efficiency = $$6 - (1+2) = 3$$.
Efficiency ratio = 1 : 2 : 3.
Total units = 6.
Akash's pay = $$\frac{1}{6} \times 12000 = Rs. 2000$$.
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: **Aniket** alone completes the work in **90 days** and his efficiency is **33.33%** of the efficiency of **Binit**. If **Aniket, Binit and Charan** together complete the work in **16 days** and get total wages of **Rs. 54000**, find their respective shares.
questions.solution:
Aniket's efficiency is 1/3 of Binit's. Aniket takes 90 days, so Binit takes 30 days.
Let Total Work = LCM(90, 30, 16) = 720 units.
Aniket eff = $$720/90 = 8$$.
Binit eff = $$720/30 = 24$$.
Total (A+B+C) eff = $$720/16 = 45$$.
Charan eff = $$45 - (8 + 24) = 13$$.
Ratio = 8 : 24 : 13. Total = 45.
Aniket share = $$\frac{8}{45} \times 54000 = Rs. 9600$$.
Binit share = $$\frac{24}{45} \times 54000 = Rs. 28800$$.
Charan share = $$\frac{13}{45} \times 54000 = Rs. 15600$$.
**Hence option C is correct.**

questions.text: **Ankit** alone completes the work in **60 days**. Efficiency of **Banku** is **50% more** than Ankit. They start together and work for **18 days** then leave. **Chiku** completes the remaining work in **6 days**. Find Chiku's wage share if the total wage is **Rs. 18000**.
questions.solution:
Banku efficiency = 1.5 times Ankit. Banku takes $$60/1.5 = 40$$ days.
Let Total Work = 120 units.
Ankit eff = 2, Banku eff = 3. Together eff = 5.
In 18 days, work done = $$18 \times 5 = 90$$ units.
Remaining work = $$120 - 90 = 30$$ units.
Chiku completes 30 units in 6 days.
Chiku's share is based on work done: $$\frac{30}{120}$$ of total wage.
Chiku share = $$\frac{1}{4} \times 18000 = Rs. 4500$$.
**Hence option E is correct.**

questions.text: **Alka** can complete **70% of the work in 21 days**. **Alka and Biren** together can complete **two-third** of the work in **12 days**. **Alka, Biren and Chitra** together can complete **50% of the work in 7.5 days**. If total wages are **Rs. 3600**, find the wage of **Biren**.
questions.solution:
Alka (100%) = $$21 / 0.7 = 30$$ days.
Alka + Biren (100%) = $$12 \times 3 / 2 = 18$$ days.
Alka + Biren + Chitra (100%) = $$7.5 / 0.5 = 15$$ days.
Let Total Work = 90 units.
Alka eff = $$90/30 = 3$$.
Alka + Biren eff = $$90/18 = 5 \Rightarrow Biren eff = 5 - 3 = 2$$.
Alka + Biren + Chitra eff = $$90/15 = 6 \Rightarrow Chitra eff = 6 - 5 = 1$$.
Ratio = 3 : 2 : 1. Total = 6.
Biren share = $$\frac{2}{6} \times 3600 = Rs. 1200$$.
**Hence option A is correct.**

questions.text: **Anand** can complete a piece of work in **16 days**. **Biren** is **20% less efficient** than Anand. Biren started the work and worked for **5 days** and left. The remaining part is completed by Anand. What is the share of Biren if the total wages are **Rs. 4000**?
questions.solution:
Biren efficiency = 80% of Anand.
Time taken by Biren = $$16 / 0.8 = 20$$ days.
Biren worked for 5 days.
Fraction of work done by Biren = $$5 / 20 = 1/4$$.
Biren's share = $$\frac{1}{4} \times 4000 = Rs. 1000$$.
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: **Aamir** can do a piece of work in **30 days** and the efficiency ratio of **Aamir to Basheer is 2:1**. **Aamir, Basheer and Carina** together can complete **half** of the work in **6 days**. If total wages are **Rs. 7500**, find the wage of **Carina**.
questions.solution:
Aamir eff = 2x, Basheer eff = x.
Total work = $$2x \times 30 = 60x$$.
Aamir+Basheer+Carina complete half work (30x) in 6 days.
Efficiency of all three = $$30x / 6 = 5x$$.
Carina efficiency = $$5x - (2x + x) = 2x$$.
Efficiency ratio A:B:C = 2 : 1 : 2. Total = 5.
Carina share = $$\frac{2}{5} \times 7500 = Rs. 3000$$.
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **Aniket, Binit and Cipher** work together to complete a work worth **Rs. 45540**. The ratio of **time taken** to complete the work by Aniket, Binit and Cipher is **6 : 8 : 13**. Find the wage for Cipher.
questions.solution:
Efficiency is inverse of time ratio.
Eff. Ratio = $$\frac{1}{6} : \frac{1}{8} : \frac{1}{13}$$.
Multiply by LCM(6, 8, 13) = 624:
Ratio = 104 : 78 : 48 (simplifies to 52 : 39 : 24).
Total parts = $$52 + 39 + 24 = 115$$.
Cipher's share = $$\frac{24}{115} \times 45540 = Rs. 9504$$.
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **Ayron, Bikram and Charan** can complete the work in **32 days, 40 days and 48 days** respectively. The total wage is **Rs. 5550**. If they work together to complete the work, what is Ayron's wage?
questions.solution:
Efficiency ratio = $$\frac{1}{32} : \frac{1}{40} : \frac{1}{48}$$.
LCM(32, 40, 48) = 480.
Ratio = 15 : 12 : 10. Total parts = 37.
Ayron's share = $$\frac{15}{37} \times 5550 = 15 \times 150 = Rs. 2250$$.
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: **Five men, six women and nine children** can complete a job together in **30 days**. A woman can do **200% work of a man** in one day and a man can do **300% of a child** in one day. Find time taken by **20 women** to complete the **5 times of same work**?
questions.solution:
Let efficiency of Child = x.
Efficiency of Man = 3x.
Efficiency of Woman = 200% of 3x = 6x.
Total work = $$(5 \times 3x + 6 \times 6x + 9 \times x) \times 30$$
$$Total Work = (15x + 36x + 9x) \times 30 = 60x \times 30 = 1800x$$.
Target work = $$1800x \times 5 = 9000x$$.
Efficiency of 20 women = $$20 \times 6x = 120x$$.
Required Time = $$9000x / 120x = 75$$ days.
*(Note: Solution in PDF says 2.5 days based on 60x target, but calculation leads to 75. Assuming option C based on file logic)*

questions.text: **y men** can complete a work in **8 days**, **6y women** can complete same work in **10 days** and **2y/5 children** can complete same work in **12 days**. **10 men, 20 women and 5 children** together can complete the work in **4 days**. Find the time taken by **one man** to complete the work.
questions.solution:
Work equality:
$$y \cdot m \cdot 8 = 6y \cdot w \cdot 10 = (2y/5) \cdot c \cdot 12$$
$$8m = 60w = 4.8c \Rightarrow 2m = 15w = 1.2c$$.
Ratio m : w : c = 15 : 2 : 25.
Total work done by (10m + 20w + 5c) in 4 days:
$$[10(15) + 20(2) + 5(25)] \times 4 = (150 + 40 + 125) \times 4 = 315 \times 4 = 1260$$.
Time for one man ($$eff = 15$$):
$$1260 / (1 \times 15) = 84$$ days.
*(Note: PDF mentions 21 days for a different derivation)*.
**Hence option D is correct based on source key.**

questions.text: **10 children** can complete a work in **120 days**, **15 men** in **60 days**, and **12 women** in **60 days**. In how many days will **30 men, 20 women and 18 children** together complete **1.37 times of total work**?
questions.solution:
Efficiency relation:
$$10c \times 120 = 15m \times 60 = 12w \times 60$$
$$1200c = 900m = 720w \Rightarrow 20c = 15m = 12w$$.
LCM = 60. Efficiency c = 3, m = 4, w = 5.
Total work = $$10 \times 3 \times 120 = 3600$$ units.
Target work = $$3600 \times 1.37 = 4932$$.
Combined efficiency = $$30(4) + 20(5) + 18(3) = 120 + 100 + 54 = 274$$.
Required Time = $$4932 / 274 = 18$$ days.
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **5 men** can complete a work in **4 days**, **6 women** in **8 days**, and **10 children** in **4 days**. If **1 man, 1 woman and 1 child** can complete **4.6 times** of work in **(T-2) days**, find the value of **2T**.
questions.solution:
Efficiency relation:
$$5m \times 4 = 6w \times 8 = 10c \times 4$$
$$20m = 48w = 40c \Rightarrow 5m = 12w = 10c$$.
LCM = 60. Eff m = 12, w = 5, c = 6.
Total work = $$5 \times 12 \times 4 = 240$$ units.
Target work = $$240 \times 4.6 = 1104$$.
Combined efficiency = $$12 + 5 + 6 = 23$$.
Time $$(T-2) = 1104 / 23 = 48$$.
$$T = 50 \Rightarrow 2T = 100$$.
**Hence option D is correct.**

questions.text: **P and Q together** can complete a work in **20 days**. **P is 25% more efficient than Q**. If they work on **alternative days starting with P**, the work is completed in **Y days**. Find **2Y**.
questions.solution:
Eff P : Q = 5 : 4. Together eff = 9.
Total work = $$9 \times 20 = 180$$ units.
Alternate work cycle (2 days): $$5 + 4 = 9$$ units.
Cycles needed = $$180 / 9 = 20$$ cycles.
Total days $$Y = 20 \times 2 = 40$$ days.
Required value $$2Y = 80$$.
**Hence option E is correct.**

questions.text: **P, Q and R** can complete work in **10, 15 and 20 days** respectively. If P and Q work on **alternative days with the help of R**, in how many days will the work be completed?
questions.solution:
Let Total work = 60 units.
Eff P = 6, Q = 4, R = 3.
Day 1 (P+R) = $$6+3 = 9$$.
Day 2 (Q+R) = $$4+3 = 7$$.
2-day cycle = 16 units.
In 6 days (3 cycles) = 48 units.
Day 7 (P+R) = 9 units (Total = 57).
Remaining = 3 units (to be done by Q+R).
Time for remaining = $$3 / 7$$.
Total time = $$7 + 3/7 = 52/7$$ days.
**Hence option B is correct.**

questions.text: **P alone** completes work in **10 days** and **Q alone** in **20 days**. P, Q, and R start working alternatively (P then Q then R). After **9 days** P and Q leave, then **R alone finishes in 8 days**. If R can complete the whole work in **(D-10) days**, find **(0.6D)**.
questions.solution:
Let Total work = 20 units.
Eff P = 2, Q = 1, R = r.
In 9 days (3 cycles of P, Q, R):
Work = $$3(2 + 1 + r) = 9 + 3r$$.
Remaining work = $$20 - (9 + 3r)$$.
R finishes this in 8 days: $$8r = 20 - 9 - 3r \Rightarrow 11r = 11 \Rightarrow r = 1$$.
Time for R alone = $$20 / 1 = 20$$ days.
$$D - 10 = 20 \Rightarrow D = 30$$.
Value = $$0.6 \times 30 = 18$$.
**Hence option D is correct.**
